de.purpose: Zur Dokumentation klinischer Diagnosen mit optionalen diagnostischen Kriterien und Dringlichkeiten. Erfordert kodierten Eintrag der Diagnosen.
de.use: Zur Dokumentation beliebiger früherer oder aktueller Diagnosen - also zur Dokumentation des früheren Verlaufs oder der aktuellen Diagnosen. Kann zur Dokumentation der Diagnosen wechselnder Patienten genutzt werden, also zur Familienanamnese.

en.purpose: For recording medical diagnoses with optional diagnostic criteria and staging. Requires coded entry of diagnosis.
en.use: Used for recording any diagnosis, present or past - so is used for recording past history as well as current diagnoses. Used with changed 'Subject of care' for recording diagnoses in relatives and so for family history.

pt-br.purpose: Para registrar detalhes sobre um caso ou obstáculo que tenha impactos sobre o bem estar físico, mental e/ou social de um indivíduo.
pt-br.use:
Usado para registrar qualquer informação sobre qualquer problema relacionado a saúde em geral.
O Arquétipo contém múltiplas datas, então pode registrar problemas presentes e/ou passados.
Um problema pode ser determinado tanto pelo próprio indivíduo como pelo profissional de saúde.
Alguns exemplos:
- Uma coleção de sintomas que estão sob investigação, mas pré-diagnose
- Desejo de perder peso, sem diagnóstico formal de Obesidade
- Desejo de parar de fumar pelo indivíduo
- Problemas de relacionamento com membro familiar
pt-br.misuse: Não deve ser usado para registro de diagnósticos formais - usar a especialização deste arquétipo, EVALUATION.problem-diagnosis.

at0000.description: *An issue or obstacle which adversely impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual. The definition of a problem is deliberately kept rather loose so as to capture any real or perceived concerns that may adversely affect an individual's wellbeing to any degree.  (en)

author.name: Jasmin Buck, Sebastian Garde
author.organisation: University of Heidelberg, Central Queensland University

en.purpose: Generic entry for an anatomical pathology test or histopathology test . This may be used for very simple reporting formats but will often be specialised or extended via the Structured Detail slots.
en.use:
Normally used only as the basis for further specialisation but is suitable for very simple tests with only a free text conclusion. Will generally be used in combination with archetypes representing other parts of the laboratory test ordering and processing process to form a full lab test report within a Composition.

Specimen slots are available in a number of positions to reflect the variation in pathology reporting styles.
en.misuse:
Do not use for standard itemised value-driven lab tests such as haematology and biochemistry- use OBSERVATION.lab_test.
Do not use for microbiology - use OBSERVATION.lab_test-microbiology.

at0.86.1.description: Macroscopic findings - more than one set of findings may be recorded.

at0.87.1.description: Microscopic findings - more than one set of findings may be recorded.

at0.82.1.description: Narrative text recorded at the time of specimen microscopic examination.

en.purpose:
To record details of a laboratory specimen. Will often be used in different contexts e.g within an Instruction archetype to describe the specimen that has to be taken, or describing the specimen which accompanies the laboratory request. It may occur within an Action archetype e.g. describing specimens taken as part of a surgical procedure.

It will finally be used within a laboratory result archetype to describe the specimen being reported.
en.use: Generally used within OBSERVATION. Laboratory and other laboratory related Instruction and Action archetypes

en.purpose: To record detailed findings about breast cancer found on microscopic examination.
en.use:
To record detailed findings about microscopic examination of tissue related to breast cancer. 
Use as a component archetype in the context of a suite of archetypes that make up a histopathology report ie OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.
en.misuse: Not designed to be used within any other archetype other than OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.

en.purpose: Record details about the anatomical location of a specimen, including highly detailed localisation information.
en.use: Use where highly precise localisation information is required, including location with respect to surgical markings or other orientation features or with respect to an image.
en.misuse: The parent OBSERVATION.anatomical_location archetype is gnerally sufficient for simple gross/surface anatomical location.
